attributes.action: Pay student nurses a wage whilst on placement during their nursing degree
attributes.background: Student nurses are expected to work full time (37.5 hours a week) with no income to show for their hard work. Due to working full time, they are then limited to finding paid work outside of placement time. On top of this, they are also having to study for a degree like all other full time students.

attributes.action: Gov to guarantee that ex and current military personnel have homes to live in.
attributes.background:
Since 2013, up to 9,000 British heroes who have served for our country are homeless. Unfairly, our soldiers already fight in treacherous conditions for then to proceed to live in an environment which is inadequate. 
The government should make sure their lives are stabilised
attributes.additional_details: This current government are underserving an impoverished population.This should be prioritised as this creates and increases a despondent underclass

attributes.action: Improve category 1 plug in car grants after March 2017 review
attributes.background: Category 1 electric vehicle technology is taking off. These cars can now give around 300 miles in range, matching the average internal combustion engine. These electric cars are becoming more attractive to buyers. In order to help the UK beat and exceed emission targets, ev's must be promoted.

attributes.action: We demand a referendum for any US-UK trade deal
attributes.background: The deal being stitched up by Present-elect Trump and the UK government could have wide consequences for our public services and the status of the UK with our European neighbours. The effect on the NHS, our education system and a range of public services could be catastrophic for ordinary people.

attributes.action: Increase funding for NHS England Gender Identity Clinics for adults
attributes.background: There are seven NHS England Gender Identity Clinics (GICs) for adults. Currently, there all of them have a waiting list of over a year from referral to first appointment. It can take months just for letters to be typed up and sent. Referrals are rising, and GICs need more funding to keep up.
attributes.additional_details:
Tavistock and Portman, England's only GIC for adolescents, recently received a large amount of funding to help it meet demand, but adult GICs have not been given the same aid.

Government guidelines dictate that no one should have to wait more than 18 weeks for an appointment, but GICs have not been provided with the resources needed to meet this target. Repeat appointments at Charing Cross GIC used to be 6 months apart, but are now closer to 9. Clinics also need more admin staff.

attributes.action: Landlords must declare mortgage arrears or court proceedings related to property
attributes.background: This petition is to make it law that a landlord must declare whether there are any ongoing court proceedings in relation to the property being let (such as repossession, power of sale etc) and/or any mortgage arrears prior to a tenancy agreement being issued.
attributes.additional_details: In November 2015 I took out a 12 month assured tenancy agreement with no break clause. 4 months into the tenancy it became apparent that our landlord was in mortgage arrears prior to our tenancy, that repossession proceedings had began regarding the property and that a further court case meant that power of sale was provided to a third party to dispose of the property. As tenants we should have been made aware of these issues prior to our tenancy beginning given the complications this creates.

attributes.action: Make individuals' contributions to the DFID International Aid budget voluntary
attributes.background: The international aid budget is out of control and management of it is not fit for purpose since much of it is wasted through ill advised means of spending or just plain poor management by, amongst others, unelected staff with their own agenda. Many UK citizens believe 'charity begins at home'.
attributes.additional_details: By allowing citizens to either 'opt in' or 'opt out' through their annual tax return, HMRC will still be able to collect the tax from those who wish to pay it while allowing others to pay their contribution to their preferred, domestic, budgets. Overall, the actual percentage size of the budget will reflect the proportion of citizens willing to pay for overseas aid.

attributes.action: Increase pay of classroom assistants/ LSAs to nearer the national average wage
attributes.background: I work as I class TA. I am not paid enough to make a living on my own. I am lucky to have a wonderful husband to help me but I want to fight on behalf of myself and for my colleagues who work extremely hard every day and put hours and hours of work in.
attributes.additional_details: The national wage for a NQT teacher within the U.K starts at £22,244 and I as a class TA earn £11,000 a year. I feel at times I can work just as hard and spend the same hours at school as some teachers. I'm not asking for the same wage as teachers but i believe TA/LSA should be earning more money so we can make a living for ourselves.

attributes.action: Stop Supermarkets from using unnecessary packaging for fruits and veg.
attributes.background: Why wrap up avocados, cucumbers, bananas, potatoes, peppers, etc.? These can be easily displayed in supermarkets' shelves without the plastic as they have natural skin protection. This packaging will go straight to our bins which may end up in landfill or even in our rivers and oceans.
attributes.additional_details: Using packaging for fruit and veg that have natural skin protection is creating waste for the sake of waste. The misuse of plastics can be seen in supermarkets like Aldi, Asda, Tesco, Sainsbury's, Coop, etc. These companies need to take environmental responsibility and adopt sustainability as part of their corporate strategy.

attributes.action: Make statutory holiday entitlement 26 days plus bank holidays
attributes.background: Currently school holidays excluding bank holiday days equate to 52 days off per year, those who work struggle to cover these dates using their holiday entitlement from work.
attributes.additional_details:
We are asking that the government raise statutory holiday entitlement to 26 days per year plus bank holidays (34 total) to enable working parents to cover childcare during school holidays. The legal entitlement at present is 28 days and employers can choose to have 8 of those as bank holidays.
Currently school holidays excluding bank holiday days equate to 52 days off per year, those who work struggle to cover these dates using their holiday entitlement from work.

attributes.action: Preserve current opt-outs should the UK decide to rejoin the EU in the future.
attributes.background: The UK's recent vote to leave the EU saw young people vote overwhelmingly to remain, making it possible that future public opinion will favour rejoining. To make this process smoother we hereby call upon the government to preserve the UK's current opt-outs for potential future membership.
attributes.additional_details: Opt-outs are when EU Member States decide not to participate in European legislation or treaties. As a member since 1973, the UK opted out of both the Euro and the Schengen Agreement on passport-free movement of people. However, countries wishing to join in future may not opt out of such agreements permanently. Therefore, preserving current opt-outs for a future British application to rejoin the EU would make the terms of future membership more favourable.

attributes.action: Get the government to remove stamp duty from buy-to-let property
attributes.background: The btl mortgages have dropped 60% since April when George Osborne brought in the states on btl and 2nd homes. This is damaging the housing market and the rental market for both renters and 1st time buyers

attributes.action: Raise awareness and put more funding into treating and diagnosing VGM.
attributes.background: My little boy was repeatedly failed by numerous of consultants, doctors and hospitals after being diagnosed with Vein of Galen malformation. This was purely due to the lack of knowledge and understanding of the condition. We're counting our lucky stars he finally got treatment before it was too late
attributes.additional_details:
This condition is deadly. A ticking time bomb in your head. It's diagnosed in pregnancy and is where a mass forms in the brain putting strain on the heart to provide this mass with more blood. So many children die because either because it's too late to treat them or because of complications. 
This needs to stop! 
I nearly lost my little boy and I won't sit and watch it happen to any other parent. 
Money needs to be invested in helping doctors diagnose and treat children before it's too late.

attributes.action: Free childcare for parents who want to return to work , child is 4 months +
attributes.background: I think parents who want to return to work and can't afford childcare should have free childcare provided or help with at least 30 hours a week.
attributes.additional_details: Childcare can be expensive and many parents find working a full week only pays childcare fees, this leeds to many parents quitting jobs to try and save some money.

attributes.action: Vote on whether the Houses of Parliament should be refurbished or rebuilt.
attributes.background: In a time of mass austerity, £4b to refurbish The Houses of Parliament over 6 years NOT including fees for renting elsewhere. £7.1b over 32 years if they stay inside. We the people believe that the palace should be kept for historical value and a new building be built for a fraction of the price.
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence is there. This needs to be done and the savings go back into the publics purse, helping stop austerity on the sick and disabled. Fund more homeless shelters, stock the food banks!!! Act NOW not tomorrow!

http://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/708740/houses-of-parliament-restoration-48bn-to-do-list-westminster

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/parliament-refurbishment-7bn-westminster-revamp-faces-three-year-delay-a6872141.html

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-37303682

attributes.action: Make learning a foreign language compulsory from the 1st year of primary school
attributes.background: The UK has one of the lowest levels of multi-linguistic speakers. By keeping up with our European neighbours we will open up travel for the individual and business for the nation. The best way to learn a foreign language is to learn continuously from a young age, when the brain is most capable.
attributes.additional_details: Communication is key in international business and the UK government wishes to see more students taking up a foreign language at university. To facilitate a future nation of polyglots we need to prioritise foreign language as a core subject for children. Starting from the age of 5, or younger, when it's easiest to learn, and to be taught continuously through to adolescence so that every future adult has at least basic secondary language skills.

attributes.action: Allow the people a referendum on the potential abolition of the 'House of Lords'
attributes.background:
The EU referendum gave the UK electorate the chance to say no to 'unelected' & ‘out of touch with reality’ officialdom in Brussels.
Sadly we have the same ‘unelected’ & ‘out of touch with reality’ membership of a club, numbering around 800, collectively known as the ‘House of Lords’.
attributes.additional_details:
At vast annual expense to the tax payer it is believed that he net operating costs of the House of Lords in 2013-4 were £93.1m, this is approximately equivalent to £118k per Peer.

I would strongly recommend that the annual total cost of the House of Lords that would be saved by its abolition, should be given in its entirety to our Local Council Authorities to help towards the increasing costs of providing compassionate care and adequate supervision for our increasingly elderly population.

attributes.action: Stop Mandatory Overtime for Parents of Disabled and Poorly Children
attributes.background: Quite often parents of disabled and poorly children are expected by their employer to work additional hours above the contracted amount, often at short notice. This expectation, if not met, can to lead to poor performance ratings, missed promotion opportunities and sometimes disciplinary action.
attributes.additional_details: For parents of these children being at home to support their family is paramount. Being forced into mandatory overtime can have a severe impact on the child's development, cause stress within a parents relationship and prevent a strong and robust support network for both the child and parent career. Removing the expectation of overtime and allowing parents to opt out of working any additional hours would eliminate stress, reassure the family and set clear boundaries to the employer.

attributes.action: Government remove failing Academy Trusts after two years of inadequate results
attributes.background:
Academy School Trusts failing children are allowed to continue with no public scrutiny.  Trust are a business model if results are not delivered then changes to who runs the School should be made . 
 Policy should be in place for intervention  at local  government level. Children need our support.

attributes.action: Make Not Paying Taxi Fare a Crimnal Offence Oppose to a Civil Matter
attributes.background: When a passenger doesnt pay for a taxi ride either refusing or just simply run away and you call the Police, their response is its a civil matter not a criminal offence. Why is it not a criminal offence. The customer has not paid for a service provided by the taxi driver.

attributes.action: Allow Donald trump free access to the UK during his presidency.
attributes.background:
Many people have been asking to ban him ? Why?

People are in outrage over a temporary ban that had been twisted by the media, Obama did this in 2011 where was his ban petition.

Please deny all future ban requests.

attributes.action: Make screening for group B strep a routine screen for women during pregnancy.
attributes.background: Group B streptococcus is a bacteria which lives inside the body and is carried by one in three expectant mothers. The bug can be potentially life-threatening to babies. In the UK, pregnant women are not routinely offered testing for group B Strep, unlike some other developed countries.
attributes.additional_details: Infection from mum to baby is entirely preventable. The test is carried out 35 to 37 weeks. You are given antibiotics in labour to help the baby fight the infection. Many women carry the bacteria. It causes no harm at all but in pregnancy as the baby comes down the birth canal it can pick up the bacteria.

attributes.action: Discipline and fine MP's who sleep during in session parliamentary proceedings.
attributes.background: As private sector employees would face disciplinary proceedings if they were found to be sleeping on the job, the British government should have rules in place to discipline and substantially fine MP's who sleep on the job.  Numerous photos and videos have emerged of MP's sleeping in parliament.

attributes.action: Amend the planning guidance to increase the minimum size for car parking spaces.
attributes.background: Car parking space width is simply not wide enough to allow people to get out and in their vehicle comfortably enough.

attributes.action: Offer U.K. citizenship to all E.U. citizens with permanent residence status
attributes.background:
There are many eu citizens who have built a life for themselves in this country over many years. Their children may have been educated here, they may bought property or married u.k. citizens,.
as things stand despite all they have contributed they face an uncertain future. They deserve security

attributes.action: Ban all landlords from stopping tenants having pets.
attributes.background: Currently in the uk millions of people are either private or housing association tenants, that rises each year. At present a landlord can tell a tenant if they can or can't have a pet. Approximately 7 million+ animals enter shelters each year. No landlord should have the right to disallow pets.

attributes.action: Payment terms exceeding 30 days from when an invoice is issued should be illegal
attributes.background: I am the director of a small electrical contracting company. It is about time something was done about the big company's who think it is acceptable to make smaller companies, especially in construction, wait ridiculous amounts of time for payment. Small businesses regularly go bust due to this.
attributes.additional_details: All company's from bottom of the pile to the top should be legally required to pay no later than 30 days from invoice

attributes.action: Put a cap on homework for under 17's
attributes.background: The amount of homework is decided by the education minister, who signs acts that will never directly effect him. It has been shown by several studies that excessive amounts of homework can lead to depression, anxiety and even lower grades. I think there should be a cap on homework to prevent this.
attributes.additional_details:
My sources:
https://factualfacts.com/science-facts/too-much-homework-can-cause-stress-depression-and-lower-grades-studies-suggest/

http://www.mindmake.com/blog/too-much-homework-can-cause-stress-depression-and-lower-grades/

https://www.psychologytoday.com/blog/the-squeaky-wheel/201110/how-much-homework-is-too-much

attributes.action: Reform the law on the defence of Insanity to benefit the mentally ill
attributes.background:
The Law Commission Report in 2013 recommended a new defence with a special verdict of "not criminally responsible by reason of a recognised medical condition".
Unfortunately this slipped through government policy making and has been ignored since.
attributes.additional_details:
The current law on insanity was made in 1848 when psychaitric illness was hardly understood. 
Despite huge developments in understanding, diagnosis  and treating mental illness, the M'Naughten Rules on insanity have remained unchanged. 
Reintroducing the proposed reform by the Law Commission would mean that people with actual medical conditions won't be excluded by the law and will stop the mentally/physically ill from pleading guilty to avoid the stigma of being classed as insane.

attributes.action: All HGVs and PCVs on british roads to have driver monitoring technology
attributes.background: Distraction such as mobile phone usage or 'micro sleeping' are major contributing factors to many deaths on British roads. Result can be much worse when in control of a HGV or PCV. Legislation to ensure that these class' of vehicle are fitted with the driver monitoring technology will save lives.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.itv.com/news/2016-10-31/lorry-driver-who-killed-mother-and-three-children-while-on-mobile-phone-sentenced-for-10-years/

https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2016/aug/04/lorry-driver-danny-warby-found-guilty-crash-death-sharon-garrett-cambridgeshire

http://www.rospa.com/road-safety/advice/drivers/fatigue/road-accidents/

https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/tiredness-can-kill-advice-for-drivers


http://www.brake.org.uk/wake-up/15-facts-a-resources/facts/485-driver-tiredness

attributes.action: Increase the fine on mobile phone use while driving to a minimum of £10,000
attributes.background: I'm sick of having near misses while cycling to and from work due to car drivers illegally using mobile phones while driving. This problem is becoming an epidemic, it's time to get tough on the law breakers who endanger innocent lives.

attributes.action: Change laws on house buying/selling make "accepted offer" legally binding
attributes.background: Currently there is no law or anything legally binding once an offer is accepted, if the buyer pulls out at any time. Which can cause the loss of survey fees and solicitors fees to the buyer. An there is nothing the buyer can do to recoup these costs or any impact on the seller currently.
attributes.additional_details: If this happens a few times this can result in the buyer losing thousands of pounds. A house is one of the biggest expenses and outgoings we incur in our lives. With this uncertainly in can put new buyers off as a house in not guaranteed currently until contracts are completed. An existing home movers off as they just can't take the chance of losing that additional money. Plus the seller and pull out currently with no impact to themselves currently.

attributes.action: Gain funding, raise awareness&reintroduce oral health education back into the UK
attributes.background: I have created this petition to gain support in introducing Oral Health Education back into the UK. As a dental nurse working in the UK I witness the daily effects&trauma that tooth decay in children under the age of 18 causes. I would like to reintroduce OHE into: nurseries,schools&the community.
attributes.additional_details:
Facts and figures:
+ More than 128,000 children under 10 had at least 1 tooth removed since 2011-2016

+ Hospitals are at 'crisis point' for children needing teeth extracted under general anaesthetic

+ £30 million spent on hospital based extractions between 2012-2013 on those aged 18 and under

+ 90% of tooth decay was preventable

+ Dental treatment is FREE for those aged under 18

attributes.action: Change the law on court child access fees
attributes.background: Every time a parent goes against the court order, that parent has to pay £220 to go back to court. It's ridiculous the other parent going against the courts order for access should be charged this fee.
attributes.additional_details: If the parent who went against a court access order was charged the fee or had to re pay the £220 to the aggrieved parent. It's totally wrong that the aggrieved parent has to keep paying this money.  Maybe if the other parent had to pay it, they would not go against court order in the first place.

attributes.action: that caravans are only allowed on the public highway between 11pm and 6am.
attributes.background: Caravans are the bane of road users throughout the UK. If they can only travel at night then it will keep the country's roads clear during the day.
attributes.additional_details:
All you have to do is find a slow moving line of traffic in the summer and there will be 1 or 2 monster sized caravans being pulled by some woefully under powered car. To add to it, it will be rammed to the roof with holiday kit.
Get this menace out of the way during the day and keep the traffic moving.

attributes.action: No sex education for under 10 years old
attributes.background: Studies have showed that children under the age of 10 do not think of sexual activities or relationships. So sex education for little children under the age of 10 years is not necessary. Exposing children to sex is the same as showing red to a bull because what you don't know you don't miss.
attributes.additional_details: There is no proven evidence that exposing children to sexual information has reduced adolescent sex or pregnancy. It should be a matter for the parents to decide if their children should be exposed to sexual information.

attributes.action: Make GCSE computer science mandatory to prepare young generation for the future.
attributes.background:
Girls and disadvantage children are left behind unprepared for the future as they are denied to study computer science.

Secondary schools are setting up high requirements for maths and other subjects for students to be allowed to take CS GCSE.

Many schools have no girls taking CS GCSE
attributes.additional_details:
The government and the schools need to wake up and realise that even if the students do not achieve high marks, they are still learning and they are still more prepared for their future. 
I was told I'm not good enough to study computer science by my teacher, but I did it anyway and finished with top marks. I have Ba in CS and Ma in IT in education. I run successful business and yes maths never was my thing. Yet I wasn't denied the chance. My niece unfortunately is denied to learn for her future

attributes.action: Give a life sentence for sexually assaulting a child.
attributes.background: A belief that the criminal justice system can do more to deter child sex offenders. There is universal agreement that there has been a lack of appropriate sentencing handed out to pedophiles in Britain.

attributes.action: Stop the scrapping of The Armed Forces Retention Bonus.
attributes.background:
After the publication of the New Employment Model across the armed forces, retention and morale has taken a critical blow.

I urge the government and MOD to rethink its strategy to revoke all commitment bonuses in 2021 in order to prevent further damage.
attributes.additional_details:
JSP 754, Part 2, Chapter 6, Section 2.

https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/514120/20160330_NEM-Pay16_Booklet_Rev_300316.pdf

attributes.action: Unban Tyler, The Creator from entering the UK
attributes.background: The US rapper Tyler, the Creator says he has been banned from the UK because of the nature of his lyrics however i believe this is unjust. He should not have been banned for lyrics he wrote 6-7 years prior and i believe his ban should be lifted, however he hasn't written lyrics like that since.
attributes.additional_details:
The letter from the secretary of state for the home department at the time sated in a letter sent to Tyler that his lyrics “encourages violence and intolerance of homosexuality” 

His manager went into more detail on his Tumblr, saying 
more importantly, this is a broader issue of free speech, the letter acknowledged he was writing from an alter ego perspective does this then apply to book writers? What message does that send? is race a conscious or subconscious factor at all?

attributes.action: Make parents who prevent other parents seeing there child liable for court fees
attributes.background: I believe that any parent who prevents the other parent seeing their child/children without a valid reason should be held liable for any court costs, if it goes to court.
attributes.additional_details: Myself and my daughter’s mum split up during the pregnancy. At first everything was fine, despite us no longer being together we still had regular contact regarding the pregnancy. Unfortunately it didn't last and at about 22 weeks into the pregnancy the contact seemed to stop. On numerous occasions I tried making contact with my daughter’s mum but to no avail. I later found out through a 3rd party about my daughter’s birth and despite numerous further attempts, I’ve still had no luck with contact.

attributes.action: Reinstate pension age of 65 men 60 women for British citizens above 50 years old
attributes.background: Government greatly reduced the level of state pension paid with recent reform. This asks Government to reverse that decision for all people over the age of 50 years who have made a major contribution to their own state pension only to see it stolen away in the last years of their working lives.

attributes.action: Phase out LED headlights.
attributes.background: LED headlights are a lot brighter than normal headlights and dazzle other drivers, particularly on dark roads (i.e. on country lanes). Please put safety above looks and phase out LED headlights by making them illegal in any future car productions.

attributes.action: Make the day after Remembrance Sunday a Bank Holiday to honour our Armed Forces
attributes.background: The day after Remembrance Sunday should be made a Bank Holiday every year to honour Britain’s war dead and Armed Forces. Many other countries pay tribute to their Armed Forces with a national holiday including the United States, Canada, Russia, France and Israel.

attributes.action: Make England have BST during winter and  BST + 1 hour during the summer.
attributes.background:
The advantages include:
-increased daylight during the afternoon.
-energy saving from lighting being delayed, producing reduced carbon emissions;
-reduced roads accidents
-health benefit from afternoon sunlight and outdoor exercise
- benefit the tourist trade
- no cost to UK exchequer
attributes.additional_details: The Royal Society for the Prevention of accidents is in favour of GMT + 1 hour in the winter and GMT + 2 hours in the summer as more people are killed on the road as a result of the earlier afternoon darkness in the winter caused by our current winter time of GMT.

attributes.action: stop animal cruelty and any type of testing on animals
attributes.background: i think that there are many other ways to test and experiment with different products in a completely cruelty free way, the UK is part of the chain of the biggest animal cruelty users in the world for no apparent reason. Research will show you scientific ways to test out products without animal use.
attributes.additional_details: PETA is a strong animal cruelty free organisation that fight for the animals rights to their own freedom, not including harmful experiments. I also think that people of the public need to be more educated on this controversial topic to understand what actually happens when making their products that they use every single day.

attributes.action: All NHS ambulance trusts to use a life saving database which is free to use
attributes.background: The AUXILIUM SYSTEM was invented and funded after two local girls were killed on the way to and from school. The database was developed over several years from discussion with many Doctors Paramedics, Ambulance Hub Personnel etc. The database will be free for the NHS to use now and forever.
attributes.additional_details: If a person wearing an AUXILIUM number is found unconscious the number can be read to an ambulance call centre, then person’s information is relayed to paramedics regarding the patient before the paramedics arrive on the scene. .The AUXILIUM number costs only £1 per year per person, and you can change as many times as you wish .AUXILIUM has offered around 1,000,000 lifesaving numbers to charities and is now able to offer all schools in the UK a free number for all their pupils around 8 million.

attributes.action: Keep EU students fees in line with UK students post-Brexit.
attributes.background: With the uncertainties thrust upon the nation we, the undersigned, call upon the government to reassure EU students that they are welcome and to commit to keeping their fees in line with UK students.
attributes.additional_details:
If the government were to commit to such an action it would be a clear message to the world that the UK is not anti-immigrant and that it welcomes, and values, the diversity and contributions of all people regardless of their nationality.

Additionally, it would show that this government is not going to use people's live as bargaining tools in the upcoming Brexit negotiations.

attributes.action: Allow all those who didn't or couldn't vote in the EU Referendum a second vote
attributes.background: Just less than 28% of registered Britain's did not vote in the June EU referendum, leave's margin of victory was 1,269,501 votes, that means 13 million potential voters for whatever reason, did not participate, they should be given the democratic right to a vote to verify the referendum outcome.

attributes.action: Review and reform behavior during debates within the House of Commons.
attributes.background: Many citizens of this country are  appalled by the jeering, cheering, and most unacceptably, laughter that characterizes PMQs and every other debate that takes place in the chamber at The House of Commons. This childish behavior demonstrates a general disinterest in engaging in robust debate.
attributes.additional_details: When the future of this country is being discussed, when welfare cuts that destroy lives and families are being discussed, it is disgusting to see jokes being made and heartily laughed at. General disorder slows the processes of power and disrupts the scrutiny of government. An immediate review and reform of the guidelines of MPs parliamentary behavior should be enacted. Those who cannot behave in a way befitting the seriousness of political discourse should be disciplined.
